content:
Diagnosis
	1. Metastatic malignant insulinoma of pancreatic islet cell origin
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative - disease control and symptom management

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic laparoscopic biopsy of pancreatic mass and liver metastasis

	Systemic therapy
	1. Commenced Lanreotide 120mg monthly from 01 Feb 2024
	2. Diazoxide 150mg TDS for hypoglycemia management

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on imaging with improving biochemical markers

	Current issues
	1. Hypoglycemic episodes - frequency reducing
	2. Right upper quadrant pain - controlled
	3. T12 vertebral metastasis - asymptomatic

	Summary of consultation
	This 58-year-old gentleman was diagnosed following episodes of symptomatic hypoglycemia. Initial insulin level was 180 mIU/L with elevated proinsulin. CT demonstrated a 3.2cm pancreatic tail mass with bilobar liver metastases and a solitary T12 vertebral metastasis. Biopsy confirmed well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor (Ki-67 8%).

He has responded well to initiation of Lanreotide with reduction in hypoglycemic episodes from 4-5 daily to 1-2 weekly. Latest fasting glucose is 4.2 mmol/L. CT at 8 weeks shows stable disease in pancreatic primary and liver metastases. Chromogranin A has decreased from 280 to 180 ng/mL.

He maintains good performance status and has returned to part-time work. Right upper quadrant pain is well controlled on regular paracetamol.

	Further investigations
	1. Ga-68 DOTATATE PET-CT - booked for 15 Apr 2024
	2. Fasting gut hormone profile in 4 weeks
	3. MRI liver in 3 months

	Medication prescribed
	1. Continue Lanreotide 120mg monthly
	2. Continue Diazoxide 150mg TDS
	3. Paracetamol 1g QDS PRN

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 4 weeks with blood results
	MDT discussion planned following DOTATATE scan

	Required GP actions
	Weekly fasting glucose monitoring
	Urgent contact if hypoglycemic episodes increase

primary_cancer.metastases: bilobar liver metastases, T12 vertebral metastasis
primary_cancer.biomarker_status: insulin 180 mIU/L, elevated proinsulin, Chromogranin A initially 280 ng/mL

cancer_timeline.value: Initial insulin level 180 mIU/L with elevated proinsulin
CT showing 3.2cm pancreatic tail mass with bilobar liver metastases and T12 vertebral metastasis
Diagnostic laparoscopic biopsy of pancreatic mass and liver metastasis
Started Lanreotide 120mg monthly and Diazoxide 150mg TDS
Chromogranin A decreased from 280 to 180 ng/mL
CT at 8 weeks shows stable disease in pancreatic primary and liver metastases

patient_facts.value: Hypoglycemic episodes reduced from 4-5 daily to 1-2 weekly
Right upper quadrant pain controlled on regular paracetamol
Good performance status, able to work part-time

status_updates.value: Metastatic malignant insulinoma with liver and bone metastases. Showing biochemical and symptomatic response to Lanreotide with stable disease on imaging
Reduction in hypoglycemic episodes and Chromogranin A with stable disease on imaging
Continuing Lanreotide 120mg monthly and Diazoxide 150mg TDS
Ga-68 DOTATATE PET-CT booked for 15 Apr 2024, fasting gut hormone profile in 4 weeks, MRI liver in 3 months
Oncology follow up in 4 weeks with blood results, MDT discussion planned following DOTATATE scan
